intro: Mammillaria perezdelarosae, commonly known as the Perez del Arco mammillaria, is a species of cactus native to Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globular shape and is covered in white to yellow spines. The plant produces yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
